item.title: Telegram Becomes Free Speech Flashpoint After Founder’s Arrest
item.description: Pavel Durov, the founder of the app, which has more than 900 million users, was taken into custody by the French authorities.

item.title: ‘We don’t stop for red lights’: drone deliveries take off as Australian regulators prepare for air traffic boom
item.description:
With everything from coffee to mining equipment now being delivered by drone, operators are exploring technology to stop connection black spots sending uncrewed aircraft dropping from the sky

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Jani Talikka was a commercial pilot flying Boeing 717s but, after ordering a drone delivery as a customer, he decided to shift gears.

“I didn’t leave fixed-wing aviation because I disliked it – but drones are cutting edge,” he tells Guardian Australia. “It’s rare you get to be a part of something like this at the start.”

Continue reading...
